definition: zero/nought/zero sign/fractional/fragmentary/odd (of numbers)/(placed between two numbers to indicate a smaller quantity followed by a larger one)/fraction/(in mathematics) remainder (after division)/extra/to wither and fall/to wither

sentences.english: But many girls end up dropping out to help with the family or earn money doing odd jobs.
sentences.chinese: 但是很多女孩還是輟學在家幹活，或者去打零工掙錢。

sentences.english: She has a bit of money saved up from her last temp job.
sentences.chinese: 上次做零工她攢下了一點錢。

sentences.english: During the day, Mr. Guo would go and seek odd jobs.
sentences.chinese: 白天郭先生有時候會出去試圖找一些零工做。

sentences.english: He did odd jobs in the following years while continuing to study on his own.
sentences.chinese: 在之後的幾年裏，他一直堅持自學同時打一些零工。

sentences.english: Chaplin his childhood in the playground and itinerant troupes busk or odd jobs.
sentences.chinese: 卓別林，他的童年，在操場上和巡迴劇團賣藝或零工。

sentences.english: He was from a big poor family and managed to make ends meet by doing multiple odd jobs.
sentences.chinese: 他出身於一個貧窮的大家庭，靠做多份零工勉強度日。

sentences.english: Twain began taking odd jobs after school to bring in extra cash.
sentences.chinese: 吐溫在放學後開始打零工來掙些錢貼補家用。

sentences.english: What chores do you have to do?
I was wondering whether you needed any part-timers.
sentences.chinese: 我想問一下你們是否需要零工？

sentences.english: He does odd jobs that bring him in ten to twelve pounds a week .
sentences.chinese: 他做零工每一個月可賺十至十二英鎊。

sentences.english: And his father by doing odd jobs there is not much savings.
sentences.chinese: 而他的父親靠做些零工也沒有多少積蓄。

sentences.english: He perseveres with his studies and odd jobs.
sentences.chinese: 他堅持的，他的研究和零工。

sentences.english: Look for a second job or odd jobs.
sentences.chinese: 找第二份工作或者做零工。

sentences.english: After doing odd jobs for a week, he got a permanent job.
sentences.chinese: 做了一個星期的零工後，他找到了一份固定工作。

sentences.english: Companies have been hiring temps to answer the phones and do the filing for as long as anyone can remember.
sentences.chinese: 公司僱傭零工來接電話和處理文件已經是很久的事了。

definition: to release from work at the end of the day
to subsist/to eke out a living/to keep body and soul together
to work a temporary or casual job/(of students) to have a job outside of class time, or during vacation
to make a hard living as unskilled laborer
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
to live one's life/to make a living
to work part time while studying/work-study program
